description:
The maximum size of video-clip files supported in a Pro account is 200MB and that in Premium is 75MB.


A video file of format .mp4, .avi and .vlc is supported by this application.
title: What is the valid file size and format of video-clip files supported by this application?
description_text: The maximum size of video-clip files supported in a Pro account is 200MB and that in Premium is 75MB.     A video file of format .mp4, .avi and .vlc is supported by this application.

description: The length limit depends on the plan chosen. For pro subscription, it is restricted to 60 seconds and for premium, to 30 seconds.
title: What is the length limit of video file that can be added?
description_text: The length limit depends on the plan chosen. For pro subscription, it is restricted to 60 seconds and for premium, to 30 seconds.

description:
The video clip feature is available on the paid plans of Picovico. If you are using a free plan, consider upgrading! 


If, by any chance, you are not being able to add a video clip of valid size and format with a paid subscription, it may be due to some errors in the video-clip itself. To solve this problem, try using another file or contact us at support@picovico.com.
title: Why can't I add video clips to my slideshow?
description_text: The video clip feature is available on the paid plans of Picovico. If you are using a free plan, consider upgrading!      If, by any chance, you are not being able to add a video clip of valid size and format with a paid subscription, it may be due to some errors in the video-clip itself. To solve this problem, try using another file or contact us at support@picovico.com.

description: While cropping your video you must be aware of fact that the crop will function only if the cropped video's play duration is greater than the frame duration you've set for your slides. Meaning, if you've set the frame duration to 5 seconds, then cropping the video to a length of 4 seconds will not be accepted by the system and it will play the video to its original length.
title: Why can't I crop my video-clip as desired?
description_text: While cropping your video you must be aware of fact that the crop will function only if the cropped video's play duration is greater than the frame duration you've set for your slides. Meaning, if you've set the frame duration to 5 seconds, then cropping the video to a length of 4 seconds will not be accepted by the system and it will play the video to its original length.

description:
You can add a CTA through the media player page. On the 'Video Settings' menu, under 'Info & details', you can see the space to add your CTA button text and URL.


Please refer this walk-through video to be able to add a CTA button to your Picovico video:
title: How to add a CTA button?
description_text: You can add a CTA through the media player page. On the 'Video Settings' menu, under 'Info & details', you can see the space to add your CTA button text and URL.     Please refer this walk-through video to be able to add a CTA button to your Picovico video:
